author: bridge-bot
content: <dankrad> > <dankrad>  All of this is speculation at this point. Ultimately, it depends on whether long-term demand is inelastic or elastic. I think it's elastic, as the use cases that are enabled will pay less per transaction, but much more in total fees (re @sharded_data_bot: <wreynoir> Random question: Is there a good explanation as to how ETH can still be deflationary after scalability upgrades like protodanksharding? Wouldn't those upgrades reduce gas fees, and thus reduce the amount of ETH being burnt?)
